item.title: John add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "We have the freedoms we fight for, and we lose those we don’t defend." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: John add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "Confucius: If you sit by the river for long enough, the body of your enemy will float by." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: John add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "the art of the novel revealed anything, it was that human nature was the great constant, in any culture, in any place, in any time, and that, as Heraclitus had said two thousand years earlier, a man’s ethos, his way of being in the world, was his daimon, the guiding principle that shaped his life – or, in the pithier, more familiar formulation of the idea, that character was destiny." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: John add a quote by Chinua Achebe
item.description: "With a father like Unoka, Okonkwo did not have the start in life which many young men had. He neither inherited a barn nor a title, nor even a young wife. But in spite of these disadvantages, he had begun even in his father’s lifetime to lay the foundations of a prosperous future. It was slow and painful. But he threw himself into it like one possessed. And indeed he was possessed by the fear of his father’s contemptible life and shameful death." -- Chinua Achebe
